title: Decorative baroque fonts
content:
I'm not sure if it's a font or maybe it's a vectors decoration...  
But i would like to know if someone can help me and if it's a font, what font it is?  
I need to enbed this logo in my site becouse it' a sponsor, but no one can give me a high resolution logo and for what i see there is a big "C" and the restant i know it's Edwardian font..  
The problem is the big "C" !!  
I hope someone can help i've tried searching on the web even tried those kind of font idefier tools around but i have no luck..

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822095403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_new_top_6290.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Clori.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822095403/http:/typophile.com/files/Clori.png) | 11.06 KB |
author: imagosonus

comments.content: I suspect it is a scan or vector of a decorative initial from an Italian manuscript from the 17th or 18th century, paired with an engraved script for "lori."
Thank's a lot for your help i will try to do a search about Italian manuscript from the 17th or 18th century...

Yes kthomps5 you're right i find some images ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822095403im_/http:/www.cantataitaliana.it/img/rm_ta_0049.jpg)  
even if is not the C i think is the E.  
Thank you so much

I have several books that contain decorative alphabets and initial caps from medieval times to the present, but didn't see anything like your sample.

Glad you found a music-specific source that will move you in the right direction. Happy hunting.
